fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The author of a pull request cannot approve the pull request. The 'Approve' button is not available
 * The user who created the pull request does not see the 'Approve' button and does not have the option to approve the pull request

h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to self-approve a PR with the new pull request experience.
h3. Workaround

Switch to the Old PR view to approve the PR
fields.summary: Bring back 'Approve' button for pull request authors

fields.description:
At this moment, org-managed accounts cannot retrieve the recovery codes using
{code} ssh git@bitbucket.org recovery_codes {code}
as the password is not accepted. 

It would be useful and faster than waiting for the e-mail period if the user could retrieve the recovery codes by this method.
fields.summary: org-managed accounts should be able to retrieve the recovery codes using app password

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Switching branch when editing a *bitbucket-pipelines.yml* file online keeps showing/editing file from the branch you switched FROM. and not the newly selected branch. while the page says you're editing in the new branch.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Consider the default branch is master
# Open the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file and click on "Edit"
# Now, we realized that its the develop branch that we should be working on and switched the master branch to develop from the edit file page
# We see that the branch has been switched to develop, and the latest commit on that file in the URL
# However, the content of the file is still from the master branch not develop
# And when we make changes and commit the file, the newly added lines will not be included in the file and the file will be updated to be the same as the master branch. 


h3. Expected Results
When we switch branch, we expect the page to load develop(new branch) branch content

h3. Actual Results

Instead, the file content is still the same as the branch we switched from. in this example, master.

h3. Workaround
Refreshing the page updates the right content of the bitbucket-pipelines.yml file as in the develop branch(as per this example).
fields.summary: Switching branch when editing a bitbucket-pipelines.yml file online keeps showing/editing file from the branch you switched FROM. and not the newly selected branch. while the page says you're editing in the new branch.

fields.description:
I am using email-notify pipe version 0.4.2. I have tried with multiple ways but it is giving me configuration issue, Please suggest a solution. thanks

Error logs:
INFO: Sending email...
✖ Failed to send email to***@**.com . Check your configuration settings.

My configuration is--
          script:
            - echo test
            -  pipe: atlassian/email-notify:0.4.2 
               variables: 
                 USERNAME: '****' 
                 PASSWORD: '****' 
                 FROM: '***' 
                 TO: '***' 
                 HOST: '***.com'
                 SUBJECT: 'Bitbucket Pipe Notification for your-bitbucket-brunch'
fields.summary: email-notify not working

fields.description:
*Summary:*

Images added in pull request comments and Pull request description do not load when accessing the that PR in Bitbucket UI, most of the time refreshing the page solves the issue and images render.

*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Upload an image to a Pull request description or under comments section.
 2. Open the PR view and you see the image loads just fine
 3. However, at times, the image won't load and just shows a grey area.

Reproducible in Chrome and with "New pull request view"

*Workaround:*
 refresh the page

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Images in pull request comments or description do not render in Bitbucket UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

To invite new users to a workspace admins must send an invitation* email. Sometimes the email cannot be delivered, e.g. because the address is mistyped, or not yet active, or because the recipient's email service rejected it as spam.

In these failure cases Bitbucket just shows that an invitation has been sent; there's no indication that the email could not in fact be sent. The admin will usually just try again a few times, then contact support to find out what's going wrong.

This is to comply with GDPR privacy regulations.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite someone to a workspace using an email address that's inactive.
 # Check the invitation status after a while.

h3. Expected Results

Invitation status shows that something went wrong and the invitation could not be sent.
h3. Actual Results

Invitation status shows that it's still waiting to be accepted by the recipient, even though no invitation was actually sent.
h3. Workaround

Check recipient email service for rejected emails. If that isn't possible or doesn't reveal the problem, contact Atlassian technical support.
fields.summary: Workspace invitations are not received by users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bitbucket repos have a size limit and when this is exceeded no more commits can be pushed, but if that really is a limit it should not be possible to exceed it.

Pushes that would take the size over the limit should be rejected so that it's not possible to exceed the limit. Then teams would still be able to push commits provided they stay under the limit, including changes to history to reduce the repo size.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Commit a large (4GB) file and push to Bitbucket.
 # Commit a small file and push to Bitbucket.

h3. Expected Results
 # This step *fails* with an error saying the repo would exceed the size limit.
 # This step *succeeds* if the previous bad commit is first deleted from local history.

h3. Actual Results
 # This step *succeeds* with no warning and puts the repo over the size limit.
 # This step *fails* with an error message about the repo being over the limit.

h3. Workaround

See [user guide|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/reduce-repository-size/] for details of how to do the steps in this procedure:
 # If size is so large that _all_ pushes are blocked, contact support to temporarily raise limit.
 # If there's just one bad commit then reset the head of the branch to before the bad commit.
 # If there's many commits with large files then remove them from the history.
 # Push new history to Bitbucket.
 # Contact support to run GC to delete unreferenced objects.
 # Restore and push any good commits that came after the bad one.
 # Make sure everyone using the repo makes a fresh clone to get the new history.

*Important:* Do not force-push clones that still have the old history! This will restore the large files, putting the repo over the limit again.
fields.summary: Push is allowed to exceed repo size limit

fields.description:
Currently, Bitbucket Pipeline doesn't support variable for the Pipe name in the bitbucket-pipelines.yml YML file.

There is a use case where customers would like to use the variable for the Pipe name so that the Pipe version can be updated with the change in the variable value instead of updating the YML file.
fields.summary: Support of variables in Pipe name in Bitbucket Pipeline

fields.description:
If you have many repositories at any given workspace, and you need to apply the same merge strategy settings for multiple repositories in the same workspace or project, you would need to change this setting on every single repo manually, which is a repetitive and time-consuming task.
This feature request is to add the ability to alter this setting in bulk for multiple or all repositories in a given project, to save time when changing this setting is necessary on multiple repositories.
fields.summary: Merge strategy settings at the project level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After generating an artifact, it is possible to download it and check it locally, however, its creation date is wrong.
eg.
 !image-2020-12-09-09-54-57-932.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an artifact using Pipelines
#* {code}pipelines:
  branches:
    master:
      - step:
          name: Test
          script:
            - echo "Test Push"
            - git remote set-url origin ${BITBUCKET_GIT_SSH_ORIGIN}
            - git remote -v
            - touch texting.txt
          artifacts: # defining the artifacts to be passed to each future step.
          - texting.txt{code}
# Download the artifact
# Unzip the artifact
# Check its creation date

h3. Expected Results

Creation date be the same as the day that it was created

h3. Actual Results

The creation date is 31 December 1969 21:00

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Artifacts generated during builds show wrong created data

fields.description:
We would like to request the ability to view the entire message(s) in the Test tab as, currently, it is limited to only 2000 characters, making it hard to review these events.

The only workaround available now is to either: 
# See the test results from the Build tab
# Save the test results to a file and upload it as an artifact
fields.summary: Increase the limit of characters in the "Tests" tab of Bitbucket Pipelines

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* Unable to add groups or users to branch permissions, it Bitbucket is trying to search for users/groups but it is searching endlessly and no results are returned

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Update or add a new branch permission 
# Click on the 'Write access' or 'Merge via pull request' fields to add user or group
# Bitbucket will try searching for users/groups 
# Searching is endless

h3. Expected Results
* Seach should return results or users and groups

h3. Actual Results
* Searching is endless

h3. Workaround
*  Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to add groups or users to branch permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When two users attempt to merge a pull request within two seconds of each other, it will result in the creation of two separate merge commits. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a PR
 # Open the PR in two separate windows and click on the merge button. This will open the merge window 
 # Select the Squash merge in both the merge window 
 # Click on both Merge button within a very small window 
 # Observe that both merges are successful and there are two commits created. One commit is empty and another one has the data

h3. Expected Results

It should create only one merge commit
h3. Actual Results

Two separate merge commits are created. One of the commits is empty.
h3. Workaround

Ignore the empty commit.
fields.summary: Merge race condition can result in merge commits being created twice if squash merge strategy is used

fields.description: Currently, there's no grammar check on commit and PR diff, customer suggests we added this feature to highlight any grammar mistakes.
fields.summary: Grammar highlight for PR diff and Commit

fields.description:
We would like to have the ability to use Pipelines SSH keys to push content to Bitbucket without having it linked to a user account.

Since the SSH key is set up on the repository level, we would like to have the commits identified as done by Pipelines and, if possible, with the information about the build that pushed it.
fields.summary: Ability to use Pipelines SSH keys to push content to Bitbucket without having it linked to a user account

fields.description:
This feature request is to add the ability to allow users that don't really have admin access to the workspace to be given access to alter group accesses within certain specific repositories.

This will reduce the risk of providing someone with admin access directly to the workspace, as these users would be able to perform actions such as transfer repos or delete them, and would also allow changing accesses on the entire workspace.
fields.summary: Add group management-only permissions to specific users on specific repositories

fields.description:
Condition block in bitbucket-pipelines.yml only considers the last commit for non-pull request sections as described in [Configure-bitbucket-pipelinesyml|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/configure-bitbucket-pipelinesyml/] (check +condition+ section)

Therefore, pushing multiple commits together with the 'condition' block in a place totally breaks the flow as necessary steps do not run.

The existing 'condition' property in bitbucket-pipelines.yml can be improved to consider all the commits that belong to a push even for a non pull-request section.
fields.summary: Conditional pipeline fails when multiple commits are pushed together

fields.description: We want to use aws ECR new feature which is public images. but awscliv2 image is not there
fields.summary: AWS CLI v2 pipeline image

fields.description:
Currently, there is a limit of for the number of successful builds that can be checked under Merge Checks. It is not possible to check for more than 19 builds. It would be great if we can increase this limit to 50 builds.

!image-2020-12-03-14-08-48-010.png|width=417,height=286!
fields.summary: Increase the limit for the number of successful builds under merge checks from 19 to 50

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The side-by-side button on SVG images is missing on the new pull request view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Host an SVG file on the repository
 # Modify this file
 # Observe the PR diff
 # PR diff only show the image comparison, not the file content comparison

 * New Pull request view
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-03 at 13.26.55.png|width=1052,height=84!  
 *  Old Pull request view
 !Screen Shot 2020-12-03 at 13.27.51.png|width=1116,height=110!

 
h3. Expected Results

New PR view to SVG file diff like old PR view
h3. Actual Results

New PR view doesn't provide options to view `side-by-side` diff
h3. Workaround

Switch to old PR view
fields.summary: New Pull request view doesn't show side-by-side option in SVG diffs

fields.description: Issue keys are scanned via a regular expression, and not validated against the Jira server. This can result in false-positive Jira issues, such as {{UTF-8}} or {{ISO-9001}}.  Users cannot know whether or not they made a mistake when they typed the issue key unless they check the Jira issue they meant to reference.
fields.summary: JIRA Integration: Check for issue validity before linking issues

fields.description:
I would like to easily write pipeline scripts that can stop (pause) the execution of the pipeline without causing it to fail, by calling this API: [https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pipelines/%7Bpipeline_uuid%7D/stopPipeline]

This is currently possible, but it involves setting up authentication to call that API, e.g., by creating a bot account and an API key and injecting the latter as a secret to the pipe.

Ideally it should be possible to call the API without the ceremony of authentication. In other words: a pipeline should be able to easily stop its own execution.

A possible use case is to create steps (or pipes) that verify if some conditions are met in order to continue the execution of the pipe and deploy to certain environments, for example based on time/date conditions or the existence of blocker issues in Jira. At the moment this requires to write a step that fails the pipeline, but that is undesirable because nothing has really "failed". It is just that now it is not a good moment to continue with the execution of the rest of the pipeline.
fields.summary: Allow pipelines to call back the 'stopPipeline' API without authentication

fields.description:
Some organizations do not require forks under their workspace's repositories.

*Feature Request:*
It would be great to have a feature that will disallow users to fork a repository based on settings.
fields.summary: Ability to disallow public or private forks under a workspace account

fields.description:
Some organizations don't want to add users to their workspace that is outside their company email domain.

*Feature request:*
It would be great to have a feature or settings that will prevent users from adding/inviting someone outside their company email domain.
fields.summary: Feature to prevent users from adding email outside a specific company domain
Error Creating Branch from Tag on Bitbucket UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you trigger the deployment endpoint, the default value for pagelen is 10. If you happen to have 11 or more deployments, you will get the following results:
{panel}
    "page": 1,
    "pagelen": 10,
    "size": 10,
    "values":
{panel}

If you test for example having 14 deployments and attempt to run the endpoint, the size displayed would be  10 which is the same as the standard pagelen value.
You will also note that there is no "Next" URL for you to query the remaining results.

So, this bug prevents users from querying deployments for repositories with over 100 deploys.
It also makes it harder to understand how many deployments you have in total to query.

The endpoint is the following:
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/deployments/

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have 11 deployments or more
 # Run the deployments endpoint with default pagelen information
{code}
curl -X GET -u username:AppPassword https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/WorkspaceID/repo_slug/deployments
{code}
 # Note the size displays the pagelen information

h3. Expected Results
# The size would be the total amount of deployments available in your repository
# The next page value would be available
h3. Actual Results
# The size value displayed is the same as the pagelen size
# The next page value is missing


h3. Workaround

For 100< deployment repositories, you can use ?pagelen=100 in the endpoint.
For 100> deployment repositories, there is no workaround other than manually viewing the deployments information in the UI.
fields.summary: Triggering deployments endpoint for a size larger than the pagelen value displays a wrongful size and doesn't display the next field

fields.description: Jira ticket link in the PR title or description or comments should open the ticket details in a modal popup instead of taking the user to the new page. While reviewing a PR, I would like to see the details in the ticket but would not like to be navigated to a fully new page.
fields.summary: JIRA ticket link should open a modal from ticket link in PR

fields.description:
Google has introduced [web vitals|https://web.dev/vitals/], which should improve the user experience. What I ever since saw on some Bitbucket views (e.g dashboard overview or pr view) that there are many [Cumulative Layout Shifts|https://web.dev/cls/].

Those are really annoying if you use e.g the dashboard overview page to quickly jump to your repo, but at the exact time you click on it another one pops up and you click on this one.
fields.summary: Reduce Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) on bitbucket views

fields.description:
I have been using and *loving* the repository-level default tasks feature. However, now that my team has iterated and decided on which default tasks provide the most value, I now have to add them to over 20 repos individually.

This, then, is a low-priority feature request to also allow the default tasks at the Project or Workspace level, which will populate PRs on all repos underneath the parent with these defaults, in addition to any specified on each individual repo.
fields.summary: Promote default tasks to Project and/or Workspace level

fields.description: I have lots of projetcts and sometimes is hard to know what are the projects with open pull requests, so It would be very usefull if you guys show how many pull requests are open on the route: /workspace/repositories
fields.summary: Show how many open pull requests on bucket list

fields.description: Some users would like to have a list of code reviews being done in a given period of time. They would like to see which developer has done which and how many code reviews (approve/merge) for all the repositories in a given workspace
fields.summary: List of approves/merges for code review

fields.description:
Issue Summary

Not able to change destination branch on a pull request created from a forked repository to upstream with a new branch option. The issue is reproducible on any fork.

Steps to Reproduce

1.  Open a PR from the forked repository to the upstream selecting the source as say "test-branch" and destination as test-branch(new branch) (yet to be created) from the drop-down

2. Now, edit the PR, and update the destination branch to a different branch and click "update pull request"
3. No error is seen, but the destination is still the same pointing to the new branch which is yet to be created. 

Expected Results
Should be able to update the destination branch

Actual Results
the destination is still the same pointing to the new branch which is yet to be created upstream

Workaround
Decline the PR and recreate it with a new destination branch
Recreated the deleted destination branch
fields.summary: Editing destination in a PR created from forked repo to upstream, with a new destination branch(yet to be created) doesn't update the destination

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The dropdown when running a pipeline from the branch page doesn't choose the correct pipeline to run if performed very fast.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Branch page
 # Click three dots on a branch > Run pipeline for a branch
 # Select a pipeline to run in the dropdown (Perform this action fast)
 # The first pipeline in that list will load if you select anything else

h3. Expected Results
 * The pipeline should load the correct pipeline even if performed very fast

h3. Actual Results
 * If performed very fast, the first pipeline will get selected even if you choose a different one.

h3. Workaround

Wait for a few seconds to load the drop-down completely and choose the pipeline to run and make sure that the right pipeline is selected before hitting 'Run'
fields.summary: Running custom pipeline fails to choose the correct pipeline

fields.description:
Currently, if you attempt to add an SSH key to a workspace that has been added to another workspace it states "Someone has already added that SSH key.".

It would be great to be able to use the same SSH key that is used by an external entity to access repositories on multiple workspaces.
fields.summary: Allow the same SSH key to be added to multiple workspaces

fields.description:
currently repo variables are sorted in random order every time i open that page

 

please sort Bitbucket repo variables in ABC order
fields.summary: sort bitbucket repo variables in ABC order

fields.description:
Currently, IP Allow listing hides content within the repository page specifically leaving the name of the repositories visible if the workspace page is accessed.

It would be great security-wise to have it also hide the repository names or block completely the workspace page.
fields.summary: Enable IP Allow listing to hide repository names

fields.description: If you attempt to access a public project, you have to log in with a valid user. However, public repositories are viewable by anyone regardless of having a Bitbucket account.
fields.summary: Public projects require a Bitbucket account in order to be accessed.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sometimes Bitbucket Cloud UI fails to load LFS files in the source view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an LFS file in the source view on the Bitbucket UI

h3. Expected Results

The file preview should load successfully.
h3. Actual Results

The file does not load.

!image-2020-11-26-15-11-44-680.png|width=375,height=125!
h3. Workaround

Click on the "Full Commit" button to view the file on the commits page.
Sometimes browser refresh also helps.
fields.summary: Sometimes Bitbucket Cloud UI fails to load LFS files(like .png file) in the source view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
User's who have admin access to a personal workspace can enforce the 'Require two-step verification' feature even if the owner does not have 2SV enabled. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to your personal workspace
 # Enable Access control feature 'Require two-step verification'. Make sure you have a premium plan
# Add a user to a group in your personal workspace
# Give the group admin-level workspace permissions(Administer workspace)
# Access the workspace as the new user
# Navigate to the workspace settings
# Access controls
# Check "Require two-step verification"

h3. Expected Results
# If the owner of the workspace does not have two-step verification enabled. Users who have admin access should not be able to enable the feature unless the owner of the workspace has 2SV enabled

h3. Actual Results
* Users with admin access can enable the 'Require two-step verification' Access controls features regardless if the owner has 2SV enable or not.
* This can lock out the owner 
* Prevents Bitbucket pipeline from triggering automatically if configured 

h3. Workaround
* The owner of the workspace enables two-step verification 
* Switch to a team workspace
fields.summary: Users with admin access to a personal workspace can enforce Access controls

fields.description:
Currently, the "Atlassian Editor" labs feature is not affecting the pull request comment's editor upon disabling it.

*Enhancement*
It would be very useful if there's an option to disable the new editor and use the old one. This gives users the freedom to choose between the old and new pull request comment editor experience.
fields.summary: Pull request comments option to disable New editor

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

After declining a Pull request, we can still approve/disapprove this Pull request
h3. Suggested Solution

After declining a Pull request, it should not be possible to interact with this pull request anymore.
fields.summary: You shouldn't be able to approve a declined pull request

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

After declining or merging a Pull request, we can still approve/disapprove this Pull request
h3. Suggested Solution

After declining or merging a Pull request, it should not be possible to interact with this pull request anymore.
fields.summary: You shouldn't be able to approve a declined/merged pull request

fields.description:
I have more than once accidentally swiped left on a Mac, effectively hitting the back-button on a browser window holding a half-written Bitbucket snippet, and consequently losing everything.  The Save button takes time to naviagate to at the bottom of the page of a large snippet, and (annoyingly) clicking it also closes the snippet.  Obvious solution -  implement Cmd-S to save the current content without exiting! 

I raised this on the forum, and it was suggested to raise a Jira, so here you go :) 

Snippets are very, very useful but at the moment I've stopped using them because I can't trust myself not to lose the content when I move to other windows mid-edit and then either

(a) forget to come back and save the snippet, or

(b) accidentally navigate away without saving

A simple cmd-S would really help.  Writing this makes me think auto-save (drafts?) would be even nicer!

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Is-there-a-keyboard-shortcut-for-saving-a-Snippet/qaq-p/1539854
fields.summary: Please provide a keyboard shortcut for saving a Snippet (mid-edit)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Performing "Sync now" from an open pull request doesn't show correct branches on the commit view
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a pull request with the master as source and feature request as the destination
 # Now, commit(123455) some changes to the feature request branch
 # You'll see a "sync now" option on the pull request page to 
 # Click on "sync now" to merge the new commit on feature branch to the master
 # Now, if we have open the commit -123455, we see only master branch

h3. Expected Results
commit view of 123455 should show two branches - master and feature
h3. Actual Results

 if we open the commit -123455, we see only the master branch
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
!image-2020-11-25-20-28-43-153.png|width=150,height=94!
fields.summary: Performing "Sync now" from an open pull request doesn't show correct branches on the commit view

fields.description:
The button color and text color all blend in with the white background making it a bit hard 
on the eyes with the lack of color contrast on the create/edit snippet page.

Its not very obvious in the screenshot below, but in my monitor (MacBook pro & Dell Latitude 7490) its more obvious.

A darker shade of text and button color (blue?) might help in this case. 


!image-2020-11-25-10-43-25-718.png!
fields.summary: Bitbucket Snippet has poor color contrast with text and buttons

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the user can only create an OAuth at the workspace level, so when they give access using OAuth, it will allow access to all the repositories under the workspace they selected.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be great if you could add the OAuth for specific repositories under the workspace. 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Ability to create OAuth on the repository level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Pasting a code block on a reply of an outdated comment causes the frame to close.
This only happens in the new pull request experience that opens a new frame when clicking to open outdated comments.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a comment on a line of code
 # Change the code specific to that line
 # Go to the pull request page
 # Click on the outdated comment in the activity tab
 # Once the new window frame opens, click on reply to the (first) comment
 # Paste a code block text

h3. Expected Results
The content would be copied on the text box
h3. Actual Results
The window frame closes.

h3. Workaround

There are two possible workarounds:
1- Paste the text of the code block without the code block formatting
2- Instead of opening the outdated comments from the activity tab, open them by clicking on "Outdated comments" on the diff
 !Screen Shot 2020-11-23 at 19.19.04.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pasting a code block on a reply of an outdated comment causes the frame to close

fields.description: If I re-run a failed step in pipelines, the logs from the failure seem to be overwritten by the new logs. I'd like to see the history there (so that I know the pipeline failed for some reason).
fields.summary: View logs from all step reruns

fields.description:
As of version 0.5.6, `aws-lambda-deploy` does not support description of the version or alias even though the underlying service does.

It would be very useful for us to specify for example git commit id.

In case of `alias` (but similarly for `update`) it would be something like:
{code:java}
script:
  - pipe: atlassian/aws-lambda-deploy:0.5.7
    variables:
      AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID: $AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID
      AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY: $AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY
      AWS_DEFAULT_REGION: $AWS_DEFAULT_REGION
      FUNCTION_NAME: 'my-lambda-function'
      COMMAND: 'alias'
      ALIAS: 'production'
      VERSION: '2'
      DESCRIPTION: 'Git commit id 0a287b3 built on 2020/11/23'{code}
fields.summary: Add support for description in `aws-lambda-deploy`

fields.description: In the new pull request UI, the previously grey check on an unapproved PR has been replaced with a green check. Yes, the words are different "approve" vs "unapprove", but that green check still makes me think that the PR is already approved. The old grey check was much better.
fields.summary: Green Check on unapproved Pull Requests is misleading

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bitbucket currently supports IP whitelisting where you can allow selected IP's and there is no feature to set allow-list based on device ID or server ID
h3. Expected Results: 
Bitbucket can only be accessed through selected devices/servers

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Allow-list for devices/server

fields.description:
We have a lot of Bitbucket users constantly using Vivaldi browser over the others. Unfortunately, they have been facing compatibility issues and request to add Vivaldi as a supported browser under the list suggested.

Link: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/which-browsers-does-bitbucket-support-296092232.html
fields.summary: Support for Vivaldi Browser on Bitbucket Cloud
Deleting a branch permission with the pattern /refs/tags/ is not working

fields.description:
As per the title, this feature request is to remove the branch names from the message in the commits page view, which takes space from the commit message.

The suggestion, in this case, to indicate which branch the commit belongs to would be to add color codes at the top of the page that indicates which branch the commit is in, in relation to the commit tree as shown below:
!Screen Shot 2020-11-19 at 17.46.05.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Remove branch names from the Message column of the Commits page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using a TOC link with an anchor that should redirect users from one page to another and scroll down to a specific header, the page will open normally but it will not scroll down to the anchored header.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Markdown file, add a TOC link like this, where the reference will not:
{code}
Please refer to the ([docs])

[docs](https://bitbucket.org/username/repo/src/file.md#markdown-header-some-header)
{code}

When clicking on the "docs" TOC link, it will redirect to the correct header if the reference is to the same markdown file. 
If the link is attempting to redirect to a different markdown file though, it will open the markdown file correctly but the anchor will not scroll down to the desired header.

h3. Expected Results
Link anchoring works on markdown files other than the file that's currently open.

h3. Actual Results

The link anchoring will not happen on other markdown files.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Markdown - Link within the same document works, however that same link from another documents will not take the user to the correct anchored title on the correct doc

fields.description:
Description:
* The side bar on the new PR UI which shows the JIRA issues shows a different count of JIRA issues compared to the old PR UI.
* If there are 7 commits in a PR with all commits have an associated JIRA issue key. Also, if the PR description contains 2 more different JIRA issue keys. The JIRA issues on the side bar only shows the 7 issues as the count. Whereas the old PR UI shows 9 in this scenario.
* Currently the JIRA issues are captured from PR title, commits and branch names. The request is to capture the JIRA issues from PR description as well.
fields.summary: Jira issues in the new Pull request UI doesn't consider the issue ids from PR description

fields.description: Looking for an API to get the number of lines of code checked-in by developers on a daily basis.
fields.summary: Provide an API to get the number of lines of code checked-in by developers on a daily basis

fields.description:
Currently, the repository description does not show the description in the project tabs. It only shows the description when the user opens the repositories. 

This eliminates the use of repositories description, it should show the repositories description in the project tab below the repositories so the user is aware of any information added in the description.

Project tabs:
https://bitbucket.org/<Workspacename>/workspace/projects/<Projectname>
 !Screenshot 2020-12-01 at 1.05.52 PM.png|thumbnail! 

This is shown correctly in the repositories list:
https://bitbucket.org/<Workspacename>
 !Screenshot 2020-12-01 at 1.05.00 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Show repositories description in project tab

fields.description:
Currently, enforcing an organization's members to all have two-factor authentication is a Premium level feature (related BCLOUD-11712), and it is impossible for an organization at any level to see whether a user has enabled 2FA, a fact which bitbucket.org seems reluctant to budge on (BCLOUD-17129).

This level of gate-keeping is a price-prohibitive argument _against_ bitbucket.org. 2FA is ubiquitous enough in the online world that the idea of its enforcement as a Premium-only feature, for already paying customers, is outdated.

At the very least, Standard-level paying customers should be able to restrict access to members with 2FA enabled.

But in order for bitbucket.org to remain competetive (against an unnamed other big elphant in the room) I suggest that enforced 2FA is an option regardless of pricing tier, even for free accounts.
fields.summary: Support Enforced 2FA Regardless of Subscription Level

fields.description:
Ability to pin pull requests.

Use Case:

We prioritise certain PRs such a bug fixes. It would be great if we could pin these so they're always at the top of the PR index so they don't get lost.
fields.summary: Pin pull requests

fields.description:
It's useful to have a button on the PR view to restart a last (failed) pipeline when the pipeline start is manual.

Use case:
 * the pipeline tuned as manual-controlled for the project
 * the PR has been created
 * the last pipeline has failed
 * a new commit appears and the PR view has reloaded

Somewhere here (red):
----
*1 of 1* build failed
  [Pipeline #6397 for ABCD-718-some-pr|https://bitbucket.org/---some-pipeline-link---]
  
 {color:#FF0000}Start the last pipeline again{color}
fields.summary: Button to rerun failed pipeline on the PR view

fields.description:
Currently, when we use API endpoint(/2.0/repositories/username/slug/src*)*

to commit to a repository, and if it fails say because of a condition "Require issue keys in commit messages Users won't be able to push commits without issue keys" is enabled in Repository settings -> Links, we receive 500 error without any additional message. 

It would be helpful to users to see the actual message indicating the error " Commit requires a Jira issue key"
fields.summary: Improve error message in API calls while committing to a repository

fields.description:
Currently, when you enable "Show Whitespace changes", all types of whitespaces are picked up, and sometimes you do not want to see the diff for whitespaces made in a specific part of your code (such as in between words of a line)
It would be great if you could select to see whitespaces made only in a specific part of your code such as leading/middle/trailing.
fields.summary: Enable sorting which type of whitespaces you want to view with "Show Whitespace changes"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Restrict users from viewing/editing commits, commit messages etc in a public repository
h3. Expected:
 # Currently, if the repository is public, users can download the source code which is expected.
 # However, it would be better to have more granular control over what users can do with commits, commenting on commits, code, etc.

h3. Actual Results

Any user can comment on commits and there is no way to restrict that.
h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Add new access level permission for a public repository

fields.description:
It would be good to be able to assign disciplines to users, and add merge checks based on those disciplines, taking into account the file types contained in the pull request.

For example, if there is a pull request that contains `.js` changes, and `.cs` changse then a review from both a Front End developer, and .NET developer would be required.

This would mean that the merge conditions can't be met mistakenly by the Front End developer approving the `.js` files.
fields.summary: Role based approval merge checks

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When a PR is merged with Merge commit, it lists both the source branch commits and the merge commit in its Commits.

However, when the PR is merged with Squash commit, only the squash commit shows in its Commits after the merge.

Users would like to be able to view the commits of the source branch as well, if they need to inspect the PR commits at a later date.

It has also been requested to show the commits even if the source branch is deleted when the PR is merged.

The use case here is: source branch is deleted after a PR is squash merged, to keep the repo history clean.
 However, user would still like to inspect the PR commits (the source branch commits) individually at a later time.
 This may be dependant on repo refs for PRs https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BCLOUD-5814, since without PR refs, the commits of the (deleted now) source branch will get removed when a git gc runs.
h3. Suggested Solution

Display the commits of the source branch in PR commits, when a PR is merged with Squash merge.
fields.summary: When a PR is merged with Squash, show the source branch commits in the PR commits list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While importing repositories to Bitbucket the "Import repository" button is grayed out if the wrong information is inputted in the URL/Repository Name fields, being necessary to refresh the page to make this button available again.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to https://bitbucket.org/repo/import?workspace=<workspace_id>
# Input the wrong/invalid information in the URL/Repository Name fields
# Click "Import repository"

h3. Expected Results

A message stating invalid information, allow the user to fix it and submit the import again.

h3. Actual Results

A message stating that the information is invalid shows up, however, fixing it doesn't allow the user to submit the import again (Click "Import repository").

h3. Workaround

Refresh the Import page and try to import the repository again, after fixing the information on the fields URL/Repository Name
fields.summary: While importing repositories, after inputting the wrong information once, the "Import repository" button is no longer clickable

fields.description:
The global (across all repositories) Pull Requests page has fixed width columns. This can cause issues if the list of rows of PRs has repositories with long names. The long names can overflow the space available, triggering the ellipsis behaviour. The resulting shortened name can be confusing, especially if there are multiple repositories with a common prefix in their name.

 

It would be really handy if these columns could be re-sized / adjusted to meet the user's needs so that these long repo names can be easily read.
fields.summary: Adjustable column widths on global pull requests table

fields.description:
When I have to review over 300 files, I can't do it in one sitting.

On Bitbucket server it is easy to see what code I've reviewed as the 'bold' styling is removed after I've looked at a file. This is re-added when the file is changed. In Bitbucket Cloud, this is not present.

It is common practice to create comments like 'lgtm' or Looks Good To Me at the top of each file. This is not ideal as it SPAMs people!

What I would like is a button that lets me mark each file as reviewed. Marking a file as reviewed should not send notification, and if the file is edited, then the flag should be removed.

A merge check that all files need to be reviewed would be a nice to have as well.

Why build this, apart from the usability reasons?

If stored in the backend, this would reduce the data storage requirements for a PR as a boolean would take less space than a bunch of comments.
fields.summary: Mark as reviewed so that it is easier to see what still requires review

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user is deactivated via Atlassian Access or Identify Provider, the users who have access to Bitbucket Cloud workspaces are removed from the Bitbucket Workspace.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Deactivate a user who has access to Bitbucket Cloud from Atlassian access or though IDP provider
* The user is then removed from the workspace 

h3. Expected Results
* Users who have access to a Bitbucket Cloud workspace should not be removed from the worksapce

h3. Actual Results
* User is removed from the workspace

h3. Workaround
* Do not deactivate users on Atlassian Cloud
fields.summary: Deactivating users via Atlassian Access or Identify Provider removes Bitbucket Cloud users from workspaces

fields.description:
As bitbucker server with code insight, i would like to allow or deny pull request merge based on report status.

 

In my case,  my  on-premise sonar server scan source code for each PR, generate a report and upload it to PR: (example: [https://bitbucket.org/keendoo/test-ci/pull-requests/50] ). Sonar upload a report with a status OK or KO.  Based on this status, i would to be allowed/ denied to merge
fields.summary: Block pull request based on report status

fields.description:
Currently support can gather this data from the backend.
A view in the UI for Admins of a workspace to be able to pull information regarding which users have 2SV enabled and disabled will help admins review the security of their accounts.
fields.summary: Workspace Admin should have an option to pull a list of uses who have 2SV enabled

fields.description: Currently, when users make an API call then API session details are not recorded in the Bitbucket sessions in the Bitbucket UI. The API session details should be added as we record the UI sessions when users log in through UI.
fields.summary: Record API Sessions details in Bitbucket UI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary When the "clone: --depth=x" is set in the yml file and the Pipelines build is triggered from a commit, the depth value is not honored

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the "clone: --depth=x" in the pipelines yml configuration
 # Trigger the build from a commit

h3. Expected Results

{code}
+ GIT_LFS_SKIP_SMUDGE=1 retry 6 git clone --depth=x https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/$BITBUCKET_REPO_FULL_NAME.git $BUILD_DIR
Cloning into '/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build'...
{code}

h3. Actual Results

{code}
+ GIT_LFS_SKIP_SMUDGE=1 retry 6 git clone -n https://x-token-auth:$REPOSITORY_OAUTH_ACCESS_TOKEN@bitbucket.org/$BITBUCKET_REPO_FULL_NAME.git $BUILD_DIR
Cloning into '/opt/atlassian/pipelines/agent/build'...
{code}

An example build: https://bitbucket.org/testnorbertprivate/testdepth/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/3

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pipelines build should honor the depth value when it's triggered from a commit

fields.description:
If the _*Require issue keys in commit messages*_ option set in the repository and the merge commit don't have an issue then the merge doesn't give any user-friendly error message instead it gives a very generic "Something went wrong" error.

The error message should be enhanced as should indicate to the user that the Issue key is missing instead of a returning generic error message.
fields.summary: No user friendly error message from Squash merge if the merge commit doesn't have issue key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When there is code at the end of a line of a pull request comment, using the keyboard shortcut (command + left/right arrow) to get to the end of the line where the code exists the cursor is taken to the end of the entire comment and not the end of the line.

This issue only present in Safari 14.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On Safari navigate to a comment box e.g. Pull request and add a comment
# Add a comment with a line ending with code then additional text comment on a new line
# Use the keyboard shortcut on a Mac command left/right arrow to move to the end of a line
# Once the cursor is moved to the end of the line ending with code, the cursor is moved to the end of the comment instead of the line of code

h3. Expected Results
The cursor should be moved to the end of the line of code

h3. Actual Results
The cursor is moved to the end of the comment 

h3. Workaround
* Use an alternative browser for the keyboard shortcuts e.g. Chrome or Firefox
* Use the mouse move cursor to the end of the line
fields.summary: Using keyboard shortcuts to move cursor to the end of a line on comment boxes on Safari moves the cursor to the end of the comment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In New Pull Request experience, you have the option to select "Show Whitespace Changes" under the Viewing Preferences when viewing a pull request. However, this setting does the _opposite_ of what it says. Selecting "Show Whitespace changes" actually hides the whitespace changes, whereas unselecting it _will_ show the whitespace changes.

Screen Recording: https://share.getcloudapp.com/6quPlp57
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make a change to a file with whitespace changes
 # Create a pull request for that change
 # Observe the pull request in New Pull Request Experience
 # Observe whitespace changes in file
 # Go to Viewing Preferences -> Select Show Whitespace changes
 # Observe that whitespace changes in the file are ignored.

h3. Expected Results

Selecting Show Whitespace changes should show any whitespace changes in the file. Leaving it unselected should _not_ show whitespace changes in the file.
h3. Actual Results

Selecting Show Whitespace changes _hides_ any whitespace changes in the file. Leaving it unselected _does_ show whitespace changes in the file. Screen Recording: https://share.getcloudapp.com/6quPlp57
h3. Workaround

Use the option in the opposite way. i.e. if you don't want to see whitespace changes, then select the "show whitespace changes" option under viewing preferences. If you _do_ want to see the whitespace changes, then don't select the "show whitespace changes" option.
fields.summary: Show Whitespace changes on Pull Request Settings does the opposite

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When user is inactivated, it is still receiving e-mails from public repositories

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add user1 as a watcher in a public repository
# Make user1 inactive
# Make a commit to the repository

h3. Expected Results
user1, inactivated, does not receive any notification.

h3. Actual Results
user is notified.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When user is inactivated, it is still receiving e-mails from public repositories

fields.description:
According to https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/limitations-of-bitbucket-pipelines/, when pushing more than 5 tags, bookmarks or branches at the same time, Pipelines will not trigger any builds.

While this limitation is there to protect build minutes, there are genuine use cases where pushes with multiple references would require Pipelines to trigger, hence this feature request to remove this limitation.
fields.summary: Ability to opt out of the push limits limitation

fields.description:
The Bitbucket UI should display a user-friendly error message when the user creates a new project or a new repository in an INACTIVE workspace.

Currently, Bitbucket UI displays a "Something went wrong" error when the user creates a new project or a new repository in an INACTIVE workspace. This error message is not user-friendly and doesn't give any indication about what is the actual root cause of the issue (INACTIVE workspace in this case).
fields.summary: Display user friendly error message while creating Project/Repository in INACTIVE workspace

fields.description:
When adding a user to the workspace in the "User groups" page, I would like to be prompted if an invite has already been sent to this user, and if so have the option of resending it. 

Currently, Bitbucket only shows the message "*Important:* Make sure the email address you are providing is working, otherwise the invitation will not go through and any future invitations won't be sent. If the invitations aren't arriving, contact support."
fields.summary: When adding a user to the workspace, I would like to be prompted if an invite has already been sent to this user

fields.description:
I have defined clone depth as full with a pull request as below. I am getting error while executing the pipeline , it says not good to run the shallow on complete repo. Seems clone depth is not considered by the script. Please suggest the solution for it. 


pipelines:
  pull-requests:
    feature/**:
      - step:
          size: 2x
          image: node:12.18.3
          name: Build
		  clone:
		    depth: full
          script:
            - NODE_OPTIONS="--max-old-space-size=8192"
            - git fetch --unshallow
            - git config remote.origin.fetch "+refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*"
            - git fetch origin
            - npm ci
            - npm run affected:build -- --base=origin/master --prod
fields.summary: Clone depth with Pull request in non custom pipeline

fields.description:
Currently, links cannot be embedded in a sentence containing a line of code. The link can only be embedded to words around the line of code. 

Other platforms give users the ability to embed a link to a sentence containing a line of code.
fields.summary: Ability to embed a link to a sentence containing a line of code

fields.description: It would be useful to be able to mark a pull request as a reviewer that it is rejected rather than declining and permanently closing the pull request. This allows other reviewers to see the state of the pull request from all reviewers and gives an indication to the developer as to where the request is. It isn't obvious if I have reviewed it and not approved it just not reviewed it currently
fields.summary: Allow a pull request to be rejected without it being closed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, there is no option to configure the default setting for "Only allow admins to deploy to this environment." at the Account level for all repositories

h3. Steps to Reproduce
There is no option to configure the default setting for "Only allow admins to deploy to this environment." at the Account level for all repositories

h3. Expected Results
There should option to configure the default setting for "Only allow admins to deploy to this environment." at the Account level for all repositories. This setting can be further overridden at the repository level

h3. Actual Results
There is no option to configure the default setting for "Only allow admins to deploy to this environment." at the Account level  for all repositories

h3. Workaround
We need to configure "Only allow admins to deploy to this environment." for each repository one by one in the account
fields.summary: Provide option to configure the default setting for "Only allow admins to deploy to this environment." at Account level

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding a Code block with "` `" in Bitbucket Cloud's editor, the first character will always get cut off 
!Screen Shot 2020-11-05 at 10.11.37.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open any section on Bitbucket where you can use the editor, such as the PR view.
 # Type "`", and start writing. Once you are done writing a sentence or word, type "`" again
 # The editor will cut off the first character of your sentence and will add "`" to it at the end instead. See the example below:
 !Screen Shot 2020-11-05 at 10.11.37.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The initial character is not cut off, and the code block is properly rendered.

h3. Actual Results
The initial character of a sentence inside a code block will get cut off, and a "`" character will be added at the end also.

h3. Workaround
You can manually change the text on the code block to add back the missing character.
fields.summary: Code block cuts off first character

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

No favicon on /dashboard/overview page
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login to BB

h3. Expected Results

I should see the favicon
h3. Actual Results

I cannot see the favicon

!image-2020-11-05-16-38-39-454.png!

!image-2020-11-05-16-38-55-041.png!
h3. Workaround

Use FF
fields.summary: No favicon on /dashboard/overview page in Google Chrome

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
It's possible to add a workspace as one of the users who are in the "write access" or "Merge via pull request" groups through the API (/2.0/repositories/<user_slug>/<repository_slug>/branch-restrictions)

Whenever users alter the branch permissions that have workspaces in them however, when saving, the workspace will be removed from the branch permission.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Call the following endpoint, and add the workspace as to the branch restriction as a write access user: /2.0/repositories/<user_slug>/<repository_slug>/branch-restrictions
 # Navigate to Bitbucket on the UI, and try adding any other user to the write access group, then save
# The workspace will be removed from the branch permission.

h3. Expected Results
When adding other users to a branch permission, the workspace will not be removed from it.

h3. Actual Results
Adding new users on branch permissions that have the workspace in a branch permission group will remove the workspace from the branch permission group.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Altering branch permissions where a workspace is added removes the workspace from the permission

fields.description:
Hello Team,

bitbucket.org is resolving to new IP, are their any recent changes?

_*Earlier we used to get these as mentioned below:*_

bitbucket.org mail is handled by 1 aspmx.l.google.com.

bitbucket.org mail is handled by 5 alt2.aspmx.l.google.com.

*Please confirm on above as we need to update same at our Firewall level to avoid outage.*

fields.description:
I've set up two-factor auth on my account. But when I go to sign into my Bitbucket Cloud account and it tells me to enter the code from my app, I don't know which app to use. I have the following apps installed on my iPhone for various reasons (though sometimes some of them auto-uninstall after periods of unuse as per my iOS settings):

 

Authy

Google Authenticator

Duo

Okta Verify

 

It looks like at least the first three are supported 2fa providers with Bitbucket Cloud. But I don't know immediately which one to use to enter the code, especially since I didn't receive a push notification.

 

It would be useful if the 2fa verification screen mentioned which 2fa provider that I've registered, so that I know which app on my phone I should go to to get the code.
fields.summary: Tell user which two-factor auth app is in use

fields.description: In order to keep our developers from creating branches that don't follow the branch Model that we have set up, we would like to have the ability to enforce the use of it, allowing only branches following these patterns to be created either using the UI or the terminal.
fields.summary: Enforce Branch Model

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If the user name is an email under the "Member" list, it doesn’t fit inside the box provided on the UI
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set username same as mail id
h3. Expected Results
Username should be inside the box
h3. Actual Results
 !bitbucketbug1 (1).png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: If the user name is an email under the "Member" list, it doesn’t fit inside the box provided on the UI

fields.description: As per the title, this feature request is to block user accounts if too many unsuccessful login attempts happen.
fields.summary: Block user accounts after a number of unsuccessful login attempts

fields.description:
As of today, whenever there are changes in a file that are not related to its content, it is hard to make a review within the PR page.

It would be great if we could have the file mode information that is displayed when you diff a file locally.
E.G:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-30 at 09.33.30-1.png|thumbnail! 

Allowing git to set file mode ensures that files with, for instance, Linux executable permissions, are still executable when checked out in another environment, including other developer's machines and CI/CD environments. 
It is easier to allow git to handle this than to force developers to chmod a+x scripts/* after every clone or merge.  Similarly, in a CI/CD environment, it allows us to assume that permissions are set correctly on scripts without adding additional scripts to update their permissions (additional scripts which also need to be executable, I might add).
fields.summary: Please add File Mode changes to the diff screen in the PR review

fields.description:
Please add the capability to enable or disable pull request branch delete on merge.

The use of the browser cache is not consistent, ideally there should be a setting in the repository administration to enable/disable "close source branch" by default.
fields.summary: Please add the capability to enable or disable pull request branch delete on merge

fields.description:
If you remove the "Pipelines" or "Chat notifications" apps from the workspace settings > Installed apps section in Bitbucket, and try to access these applications (opening the Pipelines page or opening the chat notifications settings page) the apps will be automatically installed again.

This feature request is to change the behavior when removing the apps from the installed apps section in Bitbucket, to disable these apps until they are installed again instead of automatically re-installing them.
fields.summary: Removing Pipelines or chat notifications from the installed apps section

fields.description:
Currently Scheduling in Pipelines is Hourly, Daily, Weekly. 
This feature would help customers schedule pipeline runs for every 15 minutes (or another interval of chosing).
fields.summary: Allow Bitbucket Pipeline Schedule to be set minute based intervals.

fields.description:
Hello, !image-2020-10-29-09-41-05-370.png!

the possibility to change the widgh of columns in Pull request menue.

The repository column ist to small.

regards

Sven
fields.summary: Change widgh of columns in Pullrequest menu

fields.description:
Currently the icon for Rust Lang is empty. I understand that Rust is not very big right now to receive a lot of attention, but I believe setting a default icon is not a big deal. I mean, look at Go, the default icon for Go projects is the mascot Gopher, and the crab of Rust Lang can be [just as cute|https://rustacean.net/assets/cuddlyferris.svg].

All in all, please consider setting the default icon for Rust as it mascot, like Go. Should not be that hard anyway. Thank you.
fields.summary: Set the default icon for Rust Lang to be Ferris the Crab

fields.description:
Currently, the `merge` feature is very limited. You can only squash merge, or ff merge. However, it provides no way to perform operations _before_ the merge. 

In our workflow, we rebase all branches when ready to release, in order to keep out history nice and linear. Due to this, we are unable to use the merge button because the people performing the rebase are not the same people developing. 

I would like to be able to modify the git commands that are run when I click "merge", or at least a pre-step. I want to be able to make the button essentially do this:

 
{code:java}
git checkout feature &&
git pull origin feature &&
git rebase parent &&
git checkout parent &&
git merge --squash feature &&
git commit
{code}
but not necessarily _exactly_ this; I just want more control over the process. As it stands now, I can't _use_ the merge button.
fields.summary: Add ability to customize git actions taken upon merging a PR
